name: The Tale of Commander Brage
objective: kill Commander Brage

quest_giver.description: a guard in a bad mood

characters.name: Commander Brage
characters.description: the former commander of the guard

tools: Commander Brage found a cursed sword and killed his family
Commander Brage was a well-liked man before the cursed sword changed him
description:
State your business with the guard and go! Oh, that came out a bit harsher than I meant. I am sorry for my mood. All the guard are still grieving the loss of Commander Brage.
The commander was friend to many before he found a cursed sword. He's not the man he was, by Helm. I'll not believe a man of Brage's rank could kill his own family. 'Twas evil magics of some sort. An entire unit went west after Brage to try to talk some sense to him. It's been a week, and none have returned.
The reward for the commander's head is a king's ransom, but I'll not be lifting MY sword against a brother soldier.
Travel lightly, wanderer. The woods harbor strange things.

name: The Firewine Ruins
objective: kill kobolds

first_task_locations.name: Firewine ruins
first_task_locations.description: a place where many have died in the past

locations.name: Gullykin
locations.description: a halfling village near the Firewine ruins

tools: NONE
description:
Well met, traveler. Gandolar Luckyfoot, at your disposal.
If I might pull on your coattail a moment more, I have a proposition for you. It's usually nature-quiet by the Firewine ruins, even with its violent bygone. Those who died and did not sleep have mostly found their rest over time. It's a live threat that comes now, with a band of kobolds that moved in.
Perhaps we could prevail upon you to rid us of this menace, and in return, a gift from us you shall receive. Keep whatever you find as well.

name: Firebead's Scroll
objective: bring Firebead Elvenhair's identify scroll to him
first_tasks: get Firebead Elvenhair's identify scroll from Tethtoril

reward.description: a protection spell cast by Firebead Elvenhair

tools: Firebead Elvenhair left his identify scroll to Tethtoril
description:
I, Firebead Elvenhair, have a small errand for you.
I left an identify scroll with Tethtoril, in the inner grounds. He should be done examining it by now, so if you could fetch it for me, I'd be grateful. I have a great use for those types of scrolls.
Allow me to cast a little spell on you as a reward. It will protect you from any evil you might meet tonight.

name: Brielbara's Baby
objective: bring Yago's spellbook to Brielbara

quest_giver.name: Brielbara
quest_giver.description: a female mage of minor power

characters.name: Namara
characters.description: a baby and Brielbara's only daughter

tools: Yago has cursed Namara: Brielbara can undo the curse with Yago's spellbook
description:
Travelers! I am Brielbara, a mage of minor power.
I'll pay you 200 gold, not much for heroic adventurers, but all that I have.
An evil mage has laid a curse upon my only child, Namara. She is slowly wasting away and, without help, she'll die. The mage who did this is named Yago, and I'm sure that he possesses the remedy to the curse. Would you track him down for me, please? He's been staying at a place called the Low Lantern. It's the playground for the wicked and depraved, a ship where prostitutes ply their trade. All I want you to do is find him and take his spellbook. I have enough magical skill to reverse the curse if I had the formula for his spell.

name: Vai's Bounty Upon Bandits
objective: find out why the bandit raids have been getting worse

quest_giver.name: Officer Vai
quest_giver.description: an officer of the Flaming Fist

groups.name: Flaming Fist
groups.description: a mercenary organization promoting order and law

tools: the bandits are working for someone
description:
I am Officer Vai of the Flaming Fist and, to be honest, I could use your help.
The bandit raids have been getting worse. I used to think that they were just your usual brigands out to make a quick buck in troubled times, but not anymore. They're working for someone... Damn it, this is a fine mess, isn't it?
I'll pay 50 gold pieces for every bandit scalp you can bring me — and spread the news. I want this whole region cleared, and I want to know what in the Nine Hells is going on here.

name: Investigate the Fallen Paladins
objective: investigate the Fallen Paladins

quest_giver.name: Sir Ryan Trawl
quest_giver.description: from the Most Noble Order of the Radiant Heart

characters.name: Anarg
characters.description: a charismatic man who used to be one of the highest-ranking officers in the Most Noble Order of the Radiant Heart

groups.name: Fallen Paladins
groups.description: a group of former paladins turned to the path of crime, masquerading as paladins

groups.name: Most Noble Order of the Radiant Heart

tools: Sir Ryan Trawl has heard of the player
Anarg was implicated in smuggling slaves: he was expelled from the Most Noble Order of the Radiant Heart
Anarg took some young knights of the Most Noble Order of the Radiant Heart with him
if the player considers the Fallen Paladins a threat, they are free to do what they consider necessary
description:
Greetings, traveler. I am Sir Ryan Trawl. I have heard of you. I would like to offer you the opportunity to help the Most Noble Order of the Radiant Heart.
The task of being a paladin is not easy. Many break under the demands of our path and leave to pursue avenues of life more appropriate to their talents. Sometimes they bend instead of break, twisting their paladinhood to serve their own purpose. These are hard to detect, but when found, they are quickly cast out.
Recently, one of our highest-ranking officers was implicated in smuggling slaves. His name is Anarg, and though he was once a friend, he was expelled from the Order. We thought that the end of it, but Anarg took others when he left. He is a charismatic man, and some of the younger knights were swayed by his words. We could tolerate their loss, but they masquerade as paladins, abusing our good name. They extort, smuggle slaves, and spit on all that we honor. The Fallen Paladins, as they're known, would recognize any of our Order, and some also fear conflict with former friends, so we need outside help in this matter.
The Fallen Paladins always need warriors to aid their illegal activities. We want you to ally with them, especially Anarg. He's the key to them all. If you consider these men a threat, then do what you think is necessary. Gloves of Healing would be a suitable reward for the task, I think.
Anarg has kept their activities localized in the Bridge District. I suggest you search there. May Torm be with you.

name: Set Aerie Free
objective: free Aerie
first_tasks: get the key to Aerie's chains from commoners

first_task_locations.description: in the north side of this chamber

reward.description: Aerie might be able to help the player

tools: Aerie works in the circus with Quayle
there's an illusion that makes Aerie look like a monster
Aerie has been chained: the key to her chains looks like a sword
the commoners have the key
Aerie regains her normal form after becoming free
description:
M-my name is Aerie. I... work in the circus with my uncle, Quayle... I... I'm not a monster! I'm an elf, a winged elf... or at least I was... This... this covering you see is some kind of illusion, but if you believe in it, then it becomes real! P-please believe me! Now go before something happens to you, I beg of you!
If... if you're not going to flee, then maybe you can help free me from the chains that keep me bound in this form — and then maybe I can help you!
You... you need the key to these chains. But... but it won't look like a key! There are a couple of... commoners... in the north side of this chamber...
Don't be fooled by the illusion, though... they are monsters! They have a sword which is actually my key... if you get it from them, I can remove the chain and regain my normal form!
But please be careful! You... you can't trust anything you see here!

name: Refuge for the Elves
objective: help the refugees find a safe place to be
first_tasks: find someone who could take the refugees in
tools: the refugees have no money
the innkeeper turned the refugees away
description:
We are elven refugees in dire need of help!
We have nowhere to stay... we have no choice but to wander the streets. I fear we will soon run into trouble with the soldiers of this town.
We have no money, and the innkeeper turned us away because he feared our wives would draw unwanted attention from the soldiers. Who else would have the heart and the room to take us all in?
Perhaps you can find someone willing to take us in? We would be truly thankful for your help.

name: Put the Spirit of the Child Wellyn to Rest
objective: return Littleman to Wellyn

first_task_locations.description: inn in the slums, The Copper something, one of the bedrooms in the back

quest_giver.name: Wellyn
quest_giver.description: a ghost of a young boy

tools: Llynis killed Wellyn and stole Littleman
description:
I... my name is Wellyn. I just want... I just want my stuffed bear back...
It's my favorite bear, Littleman... The bad man who came into our house... he—he hurt me, and he took Littleman with everything else... *sob* I can never go to sleep without Littleman! The bad man has it at that inn in the slums. The Copper something. *sniff* He's in one of those bedrooms in the back! I think his name is "Llynis"...
I've... I've gone to him... *sob*... I've tried to tell him that I just want my bear, please, but he just gets too frightened of me. *sob* Oh, please get it from him!

name: Heeding the Spirit of the Grove
objective: serve the grove as a leader bringing balance

first_task_locations.description: along the path to the east of the troll mound

characters.name: Nilthiri
characters.description: a shamaness, and the leader of the trolls of the troll mound
characters.location: along the path to the east of the troll mound

tools: the player is a druid
Nilthiri will overrun the grove if not stopped
description:
I am the spirit of the grove, child. I am the water, the earth, the trees, and the sun. I am life and death: the eternal cycle.
A druid who serves the cause of balance is needed. The grove requires leadership, a gentle hand. Will you serve the grove as such? There is much work to be done. Listen and learn the path of balance, the path of the Eternal Cycle.
Long have the trolls of the mound lived beneath the protection of the grove. But a new leader has arisen. Nilthiri the shamaness leads the trolls to chaos. She urges them to expand their territory, and she brings more trolls to the mound without thought to the consequences. If this continues, the trolls will overrun the grove, and nature will suffer. A servant of nature must bring the life cycle of Nilthiri to a close for the good of all.
You will find Nilthiri along the path to the east of the troll mound.

name: Fleeting Strength
objective: give a Potion of Strength to Mister Meek
tools: Mister Meek has heard that the player help people
description:
You're the one who's been helping people, right? Well, now you could help me too.
You see, I need to get my hands on a Potion of Strength. I'm not the strongest person around: for once, I'd like to carry things around as if they were mere feathers.
Give me the potion, and receive a precious diamond in return.

name: A Fancy New Shirt
objective: give a leather tunic to Narcissos
tools: the player is not wearing any kind of armor
description:
Aren't I just the handsomest man in this village? I'd like to become even flashier than I am now.
Even you, traveler, lack any kind of flashy armor. I could give you my old, crummy diamond chestplate so that you'd look a bit less embarrassing.
However, I want you to give me a brand new leather tunic in return.

name: Taking Notes
objective: give a book and quill to Larry
tools: the player is an enemy of Larry: the player hit Larry
description:
Don't you dare to scratch my books with your breath! I have not forgotten your vile deeds. Why did you even hit me?
You can make up for your violent nature, though. Bring me a book and quill, it should help with a little project of mine. I'd love to catalog my books in a more orderly fashion.
Help me out, and I'll forgive you for hitting me. I'd even give you an enchanted book.

name: A Talkative Pet
objective: bring a tamed parrot to Olivia
tools: Olivia gives the player seeds that can be used to tame a parrot
description:
My mommy and daddy say that I can't go outside the village. I don't! But I really wanna have a parrot. The other kids would certainly like me better if I had a cool pet like a parrot!
You a big enough to travel to places on your own without your parents. Traveler, please tame a parrot and bring it to me. I even have some seeds for you: tame the parrot with them. Parrots live in jungles.
I will give you this diamond I once found on the ground. Even a kid like me knows that those are valuable.

name: Elytra Air Show
objective: complete Alex's Elytra obstacle course
first_tasks: talk to Alex when you are ready

items.name: Elytra
items.description: wings that let the player fly

tools: the player has an Elytra
description:
You've got a nice pair of wings on you. Would you care to try my Elytra obstacle course? Villagers might enjoy to see you fly. Perhaps they'd even want to try my course after seeing you go through it. Just talk to me when you are ready.
Good performances are awarded with cool prizes!

name: Affairs of a Wizard
objective: assassinate Celedaen
first_tasks: search for Celedaen's written records that may contain evidence of some kind of weakness of his

quest_giver.name: Lucien Lachance
quest_giver.description: the player's superior in the Dark Brotherhood, giving quest via "Dead Drop Orders #1"

reward.description: the player should go to Chorrol for their next dead drop: at the foot of the Great Oak, hidden in the bushes, is an old sack containing the player's reward and their next contract

items.name: "Dead Drop Orders #1"
items.description: the player's first dead drop note, on Hero Hill

characters.name: Celedaen
characters.description: an ancient necromancer, who is in the process of turning himself into a lich

tools: "Dead Drop Orders #1" is addressed to the player: the player is a Silencer of the Dark Brotherhood
description:
Dead Drop Orders #1
by Lucien Lachance

Silencer,
You are now reading your first dead drop note, here on Hero Hill, which proves to me you were well-appointed to the tasks that lie ahead.
Journey now to Leafrot Cave. There you will encounter an ancient necromancer who is attempting to escape death by transforming himself into a lich. This necromancer, Celedaen, has not yet completed his metamorphosis, but is still immensely powerful, possibly too powerful to destroy if confronted directly. Search Leafrot Cave. Necromancers are wizards after all, and wizards are prolific by nature. Celedaen surely has written records, and these records may contain evidence of some kind of weakness. Perhaps there is some other way to destroy Celedaen besides a direct confrontation. But destroy him you must!
When the necromancer lies dead, journey to the city of Chorrol for your next dead drop. At the foot of the Great Oak, hidden in the bushes, is an old sack. Inside you will find your reward for killing the necromancer, as well as information regarding your next contract.
Serve me well, Silencer, and there's no telling just how far you might advance.

name: The Sunken One
objective: investigate the Sunken One

first_task_locations.name: Sandstone Cavern
first_task_locations.description: the offering place of the Sunken One

quest_giver.name: Slythe Seringi
quest_giver.description: a worried man, giving quest via "Slythe's Journal"

characters.name: Sunken One, He Who Shakes The Ground

tools: Kvatch was destroyed because they did not heed Slythe Seringi's warning about the Sunken One
Slythe Seringi has gone to give an offering to the Sunken One so that he does not sack any other cities: Anvil, Chorrol, the Imperial City
description:
Slythe's Journal
by Slythe Seringi

As midnight approaches, I still watch the fires burn. The great city of man, Kvatch, lay in ruins. They didn't heed my words. They didn't listen to my voice. Now, they are all paying the cost of ignorance. The Sunken One strikes swift and hard. He swats those who oppose Him as if they did not exist at all. The excuses of man fall upon deaf ears. The Sunken One has no pity; He has no mercy, He only sits below and passes sentence. And now, with a mighty stroke, He's toppled one of man's pitiful blights on His land. And yet, He still hungers. His appetite is voracious. Kvatch will not be the last city to fall by His hand. The world of man grows more and more corrupt, and it angers Him. Man's lies and deceit will be his undoing as The Sunken One grows impatient and no longer waits for or accepts the proper offering.
The burden is mine to shoulder. I am the last who knows of He Who Shakes The Ground. If I do not bring him the Offering, who knows what city may fall prey to his whim? Anvil? Chorrol? Or perhaps He will turn his eyes on the greatest boil of all, the great Imperial City itself. No, I must not let that happen. I must get the Offering to him like my father did before me. Man may be fallen in His eyes, but they must have time to learn The Sunken One's teachings. Destroying man now would be a waste, when I am certain that given the chance, they will come to see His ways. Yes, I will do this thing. I will brave the depths of Sandstone Cavern to see Him. My weapons will be my will and my word. The Sunken One will watch over me and guide me. I must depart soon, before it is too late. If anyone finds this journal, let them know that I, Slythe Seringi, do this for the good of all man.

name: Nature's Fury
objective: retrieve the Boots of the Crusader for yourself
first_tasks: talk to the priests of Kynareth

first_task_locations.name: Shrine of Kynareth
first_task_locations.description: west of the Imperial City, on the edge of the Great Forest

tools: Sir Juncan died while seeking out the Boots of the Crusader
description:
My name was Sir Juncan.
I wish to see you succeed where I failed. I was on the path to the Boots of the Crusader, but died before I reached them.
I cannot tell you exactly how to find the Boots, for that will be up to Kynareth. I can tell you to seek out her Priests, though. West of the Imperial City, on the edge of the Great Forest, is a shrine. You will find them there, and they will tell you what you need to know.

name: Spies
objective: track down the spies, kill them and find out what they know

characters.name: Steffan
characters.description: a male gate guard who has seen the spies

characters.name: Captain Burd
characters.description: a male captain of the guard

tools: the gate guards have reported seeing strangers on the road for the past several nights: Jauffre cannot leave Cloud Ruler undefended while his men search the whole mountainside
Jauffre has asked the Countess of Bruma to have the guard keep an eye out for strangers
description:
I hope you can help. The gate guards have reported seeing strangers on the road for the past several nights.
I cannot leave Cloud Ruler undefended while my men search the whole mountainside, but these spies must be eliminated. Talk to Steffan. He can tell you where he has seen them. Captain Burd in Bruma may also be able to help. I've asked the authorities of Bruma to have the guard keep an eye out for strangers.
Track down the spies and kill them. Find out what they know, and what they're planning, if possible.

name: Buying a House in Skingrad
objective: purchase Rosethorn Hall

reward.name: Rosethorn Hall
reward.description: a large manor house in Skingrad, just inside the main gate, near the bridge to the chapel

tools: the player told Shum gro-Yarug that they want to buy a house
Rosethorn Hall is currently occupied by Vandorallen Trebatius
Shum gro-Yarug will have Vandorallen Trebatius evicted from Rosethorn Hall
description:
I'm Shum gro-Yarug, the Count's butler.
So you want to buy a house? I can speak for the Count. Rosethorn Hall is a stately manor currently occupied by Vandorallen Trebatius. You won't find a better property for sale in Skingrad. It's just inside the main gate, near the bridge to the chapel.
The house costs 25,000 septims. Give me the septims, and I will order the deed to the house drawn up.
Don't worry about Vandorallen Trebatius. I'll have him evicted. I'm sure he'll find another home easily.

name: Buying a house in Bravil
objective: purchase the house in Bravil

reward.description: house in Bravil, an ugly, modest, fairly bare shack overlooking the canal

tools: the player told Regulus Terentius that they are looking to buy a house in Bravil
Nilawen sells furnishings
description:
Regulus Terentius, Count of Bravil. So you're looking for a house to buy here in Bravil? Really?
It just so happens there is a modest shack overlooking the canal. It's not much to look at, but the smell will soon make you forget how ugly it is. Pay me 4,000 gold, and it's all yours.
I'll have my steward register the deed of ownership. It's squalid little shack, I'm sorry to say. Oh, and the place is fairly bare. If I were you, I'd head on over to Nilawen at The Fair Deal and get some furnishings. Or you could always eat off the floor... doesn't matter to me.

name: Mephala's Web of Lies
objective: Start a feud between two prominent families
first_tasks: kill the leaders of the two families and plant evidence to implicate the other family as the killer

quest_giver.name: Mephala, 'Webspinner'
quest_giver.description: the queen of lies, one of the Daedric Princes

tools: in Bleaker's Way, two families, Nord and Dunmer, live in perfect harmony
don't get caught or killed while starting the feud
description:
I'm Mephala. Call me 'Webspinner'. Pluck but a single thread, and the weave unravels.
In Bleaker's Way, two families, Nord and Dunmer, live in perfect harmony. But beneath the surface lurks the secret seed of strife. Kill the leaders of the two families. Plant evidence to implicate the other family as the killer. And don't get caught. Be cunning. Don't spoil my scheme. And don't die... that would spoil everything. Ha-ha-ha-hah!
And there'll be a little needle to help you stitch your own tangled tapestries: the Ebony Blade.

name: The Paranoid Roof Watcher
objective: find the hidden stash of Unknown

first_task_locations.description: the sewage near the back of Bernice's inn, in Crucible

quest_giver.name: Unknown
quest_giver.description: a paranoid resident of Crucible, giving quest via "Faded Note"

locations.name: Crucible
locations.description: a district of a great city

tools: Unknown is dying
Unknown is a drunk
the house of Unknown was stolen by Brithaur
Unknown thinks that Bernice, Caldana, Earil, and Cutter are plotting against him
description:
Faded Note
The last thoughts of one of Crucible's residents

I don't think I'll live much longer. My wine supply is thinning, only one bottle left. Bernice's wine is worthless! I would have lasted longer on bark. I'd go back home to resupply, but Brithaur, that maggot, has stolen my house. It's not just him, though, it's also the others. I can't leave the safety of the roof. They have a plan for me, I see it in their eyes. Caldana, Earil, Cutter, ALL OF THEM!
They don't know I'm up here, watching. Not much longer, though. At least they won't find me or my stash. I've put all my favorite things in an urn, and sunken it in the sewage near the back of Bernice's dive.
I think I'll drink that last bottle to celebrate.

name: Blood Money
objective: investigate a number of merchants' deaths along the Gold Road
first_tasks: speak with Arielle Jurard about further instructions

quest_giver.name: Carahil
quest_giver.description: the leader of one of the guild halls of Mages Guild

groups.name: Council of Mages
groups.description: the ruling body of Mages Guild

tools: the player asked a recommendation from Carahil: the player is new to the Mages Guild
the Council of Mages has entrusted Carahil to take care of an issue of merchant killings along the Gold Road
a rogue mage is suspected of the merchant killings: the only link between the victims is the Brina Cross Inn
battlemages have been sent to the Brina Cross Inn
the player can learn Restoration while facing a life and death situation
description:
So you are here for your recommendation? Unlike some frivolous tasks you may be given at other guild halls, this is a serious matter, and has consequences. Are you prepared?
Allow me to explain the task. The Council of Mages has entrusted me with resolving a situation along the Gold Road. Several traveling merchants have been found dead along the Gold Road recently, with even more missing. The Council has asked that I put a stop to it. You are going to help me do so.
As you are new to the guild, you are less likely to be recognized as a member. This may give you an advantage in getting to the root of the problem. We believe the killings are the actions of a rogue mage. Battlemages have been sent to the Brina Cross Inn, the only common link between the victims.
You are to travel north to the Brina Cross Inn, and speak with Arielle Jurard. She will give you further instructions.
This is a harsh, dangerous task for you, I realize. Your unfamiliar face makes you most useful, however. And, what better way to learn the many uses of Restoration? Practical application is often the best educator. Even in life and death situations.

name: Through A Nightmare, Darkly
objective: help Kud-Ei save her friend Henantier
tools: Henantier and Kud-Ei were study-mates at the Arcane University
Henantier gets into trouble because of his careless experiments: Kud-Ei fears that Henantier has done this again
Henantier is trapped and there is no way Kud-Ei can free him
description:
Kud-Ei. I don't suppose you could help me locate my friend Henantier could you? If you find him, I'll be glad to offer you a sizable reward.
I miss Henantier so. We were study-mates at the Arcane University and we've come to grow fond of each other over the years. He's always getting himself into jams with the careless ways he performs his experiments, and well, I'm afraid he's done it again.
I'm going to level with you, as you seem like you wish to help. Henantier isn't missing. On the contrary, I know exactly where he is. The problem is he's trapped and there's no way I can free him.
Follow me. We aren't going far, so no need to prepare for a long journey. In fact, Henantier's still in town. More I can't say aloud without risk of others hearing.

name: The Potato Snatcher
objective: return the Jumbo Potatoes to S'jirra
first_tasks: find the person who stole S'jirra's Jumbo Potatoes
tools: NONE
description:
Ohhhh... what am I, S'jirra, to do? They're gone... all gone.
Can you help me find my lost Jumbo Potatoes? Please, you must help me find them! If I don't have them for the next batch of my famous potato bread, I don't know what I'll do! My potatoes are like my children. I care for and nurture each one individually. That way, they grow up to be big and strong. How stupid I was to leave them outside all alone like that! All I wanted to do was give them some sun. Next thing I knew, they were gone!
I saw someone running off to the west, but I'm too frightened to journey into the woods alone. Please... can you help me? I'll give you my famous potato bread. I swear!

name: Awakening
objective: find out what vampires are looking for at Dimhollow Crypt
first_tasks: meet Tolan, who will try to assist you

quest_giver.name: Isran
quest_giver.description: the player's leader in the Dawnguard

characters.name: Tolan
characters.description: a male member of the Vigilants of Stendarr

tools: the Dawnguard are getting the Dawnguard Fortress back into shape
Isran gives the player a crossbow: crossbows are good for hunting vampires before they get too close
description:
I need someone out in the field, taking the fight to the damn vampires, while we're getting the fort back into shape...
Go see what the vampires were looking for in Dimhollow Crypt. With any luck, they'll still be there. Here, you should take a crossbow. Good for hunting out those fiends before they get too close.
Tolan'll meet you at Dimhollow. He will try to assist you. Watch out. Vigilants of Stendarr were never trained for vampire hunting...

name: The Golden Claw
objective: retrieve a golden dragon claw for Lucan Valerius

quest_giver.name: Lucan Valerius
quest_giver.location: Lucan Valerius's shop in the town

tools: the golden dragon claw was stolen from Lucan Valerius' shop
description:
We did have a bit of a... break-in. But we still have plenty to sell. Robbers were only after one thing. An ornament, solid gold. In the shape of a dragon's claw.
I've got some coin coming in from my last shipment. It's yours if you bring my claw back. If you're going after those thieves, you should head to Bleak Falls Barrow, northeast of town.

name: Pilgrimage
objective: help Alessandra make peace with her dead father
first_tasks: bring Alessandra's ceremonial dagger to Andurs so it can be interred with Alessandra's father's remains

first_task_locations.name: Hall of the Dead
first_task_locations.description: a hall where bodies are interred and cared for, in Whiterun

characters.name: Arkay
characters.description: the god of burials and funeral rites

tools: Alessandra did not want to become a Priest of Arkay like her father
Alessandra gives the player her ceremonial dagger
description:
I am Alessandra, a priest of Arkay.
My father was a Priest of Arkay, as well. All my life was spent around the dead, being forced to learn the proper burial rituals and prayers. I never had any friends; who'd want to spend time with 'the little weird girl who hangs around dead people?' So I grew up with a miserable trade. This is all I know how to do... prepare and inter the deceased.
I'd like to make the journey to the Hall of the Dead in Whiterun and give my ceremonial dagger to Andurs, the caretaker. I believe once it's interred with my father's remains I'll be at peace with his memory.
A Priest of Arkay is entrusted with a ceremonial dagger once they've completed their training. It's usually given by the head priest who sanctified the ritual. In my case, the head priest happened to be my father. The thing is, I never wanted to follow in his footsteps... In some ways I still don't.
I'm entrusting you with the dagger. Bring it to Andurs and he'll take care of the rest.

name: Weather the Storm
objective: protect Whiterun from the Stormcloak invasion

quest_giver.name: Legate Rikke
quest_giver.description: the player's commanding officer in the Imperial Legion

characters.name: Ulfric
characters.description: the man who leads the Stormcloaks

groups.name: Stormcloaks
groups.description: rebel forces opposing the Empire in Skyrim

tools: Legate Rikke is addressing the player and the player's fellow legionnaires: the Imperial legion will send a message to Ulfric and the rebel Jarls who support him
description:
This is it men! This is an important day for the Empire and for the Legion. And for all of Skyrim.
This is the day we send a message to Ulfric and the rebel Jarls who support him. We will protect Whiterun from Stormcloaks. But make no mistake. What we do here today, we do for Skyrim and her people. By cutting out the disease of this rebellion, we will make this country whole again!
Ready now! Everyone, with me! For the Empire! For the Legion!

name: The Impatient Jarl
objective: deliver a note to Skald the Elder
first_tasks: tell Skald the Elder that he will get his lumber
tools: NONE
description:
If you're one of the Jarl's men, you'll get your lumber. Anga's Mill pays its debts.
Sorry, I thought Skald the Elder sent you. We've got an order to fill, and he's not known for patience.
Look, if you're heading towards Dawnstar anytime soon, can you give the Jarl this note? Let him know he'll get his lumber.

name: Get Outfitted
objective: get a free set of armor
first_tasks: select light, medium, or heavy armor
tools: the player came for their free armor
the player only gets one free outfit
description:
I have just one question for you. Light, medium, or heavy?
Light armor for scouting detail, heavy armor for full on combat, or something in between?
Now, that'll be it. One free outfit per soldier. You lose that, or get it banged up, you'll need to pay like everyone else.

name: Trinity Restored
objective: transact the oath with Nocturnal and become one of the Nightingales
first_tasks: undergo the ceremony to become a Nightingale

quest_giver.name: Karliah
quest_giver.description: a fellow member of the Thieves Guild, and a Nightingale

reward.description: all of the power and knowledge befitting a Nightingale

groups.name: Nightingales
groups.description: a trio of highly skilled thieves dedicated to the service of Nocturnal

tools: the binding terms of the oath with Nocturnal: the player will be required to defend the Twilight Sepulcher and everything within when the need arises, and upon the player's death, the player's spirit will be bound to the Twilight Sepulcher as one of its guardians
description:
Are you ready to transact the Oath with Nocturnal?
By transacting the Oath with Nocturnal, you're entering into a business deal. You'll be provided all of the power and knowledge befitting a Nightingale. You're free to use those powers as you see fit to further your own goals or the goals of the Thieves Guild.
In return, you'll be required to defend the Twilight Sepulcher and everything within when the need arises. More importantly, upon your death, your spirit will be bound to the Twilight Sepulcher as one of its guardians.
Once the Oath has been struck, the terms are binding. Knowing this, are you ready to undergo the ceremony?

name: Sanctuary
objective: begin your new life as a member of the Dark Brotherhood, and see Astrid
first_tasks: find the entrance to the Dark Brotherhood Sanctuary, and answer "Silence, my brother." when questioned by the black door

first_task_locations.description: in the southwest reaches of the realm, in the pine forest

quest_giver.name: Astrid
quest_giver.description: the player's guildmaster in the Dark Brotherhood

items.name: "Silence, my brother."
items.description: the passphrase to the Dark Brotherhood Sanctuary

locations.name: Dark Brotherhood Sanctuary
locations.description: the headquarters of the Dark Brotherhood

tools: Astrid officially welcomes the player to the Dark Brotherhood
description:
I would like to officially extend to you an invitation to join my Family: the Dark Brotherhood.
In the southwest reaches of the realm, in the Pine Forest, you'll find the entrance to our Sanctuary. It's just beneath the road, hidden from view. When questioned by the Black Door, answer with the correct passphrase: "Silence, my brother." Then you're in. And your new life begins.
I'll see you at home.

name: Assassin at Large
objective: kill the Khajiit who wants to assassinate Malborn

first_task_locations.description: around the main gate of Windhelm

characters.name: Khajiit
characters.location: around the main gate of Windhelm

locations.name: Morrowind
locations.description: a land inhabited by the Dunmer

groups.name: Thalmor
groups.description: an organization that kills anyone who oppose them

groups.name: Dunmer
groups.description: a race of people who do not like the Thalmor

tools: the player saved Malborn from the Thalmor in the past
Malborn could not leave Windhelm for Morrowind because of the Khajiit
description:
Oh, it's you. I didn't expect to see you again.
I'm trying to stay alive. I think time's running out though. I'm pretty sure the Thalmor know where I am. Maybe you can help me.
I was trying to get to Morrowind. The Dunmer don't care much for the Thalmor and I figured I'd be safe there. As safe as anywhere, that is. But there's a Khajiit hanging around the main gate. I didn't like the way he was looking at me. I'm sure he's Thalmor. Just waiting for me to leave Windhelm so he can follow me and kill me in a lonely place.
You'd be saving my life. Again. I know I probably seemed ungrateful... I've just been so scared. Expecting a knife at my throat any minute.

name: Kill the Forsworn Leader
objective: kill a Forsworn leader

quest_giver.name: Igmund
quest_giver.description: an honorable nobleman who rules over Markarth

tools: NONE
description:
Are you a sellsword? I don't like your kind. No honor. No loyalty. Unreliable. But I can't turn away a potential ally in these times. Let's see if you're better than a common mercenary.
My scouts have tracked down one of the Forsworn leaders, hiding out in their blood-soaked camps at Serpent's Bluff Redoubt. Deal with that Forsworn leader.

name: The Path of Knowledge
objective: find the Black Book

reward.name: Black Book
reward.description: a book that is connected with Miraak

groups.name: Dwemer
groups.description: an ancient, extinct race of people who were specialized in forbidden knowledge

tools: the Dwemer discovered the Black Book that is connected with Miraak
Neloth found the Dwemer's "reading room" in Nchardak: Neloth was not able to open the protective case where the Black Book is sealed
description:
I know where to find the Black Book connected with Miraak. I haven't been able to get it, though. But maybe together we can unlock the secrets the Dwemer left behind.
Forbidden knowledge was somewhat a specialty of the ancient Dwemer. It seems they discovered this book and took it to study. I have found their "reading room" in the ruins of Nchardak. The book is there, but it's sealed in a protective case which I wasn't able to open.
But perhaps the two of us together will be able to get the book. To Nchardak, then. Follow me.

name: Climb the Steps
objective: deliver a bag of food supplies to the Greybeards for Klimmek
first_tasks: climb the 7,000 steps to High Hrothgar, and put the bag of food supplies in the offering chest at the top of the steps

groups.name: Greybeards
groups.description: an order of wise old men

locations.name: High Hrothgar
locations.description: the secluded home of the Greybeards

tools: NONE
description:
Passing through on your way to High Hrothgar? About to make a delivery up there myself.
I mostly deliver food supplies like dried fish and salted meats; you know, things that keep fresh for a long time. The Greybeards tend not to get out much, if you catch my meaning.
It's kind of an understanding between us. I mean, it just wouldn't feel right to charge them for a bit of preserved food. Trouble is, my legs aren't what they used to be and climbing the 7,000 Steps takes its toll.
You'd like to make the delivery for me? Really? That would be kind of you. Here, take this bag of supplies. At the top of the steps you'll see the offering chest. Just leave the bag inside and you're done.

name: Pain in the Necklace
objective: bring East Empire Pendants to Fethis Alor

first_task_locations.name: Solstheim
first_task_locations.description: an island with old East Empire Company mines

quest_giver.name: Fethis Alor
quest_giver.description: a merchant who used to sell East Empire Pendants

items.name: East Empire Pendants
items.description: popular amulets that were made exclusively for the East Empire Company, a popular collectible

tools: the player asked Fethis Alor whether he sells special mining gear: he does not
description:
Mining gear? No. However, I used to sell East Empire Pendants until I ran out of them. Popular little item.
It's an amulet that was made exclusively for the East Empire Company. They gave them to their workers as an incentive at one point... a kind of reward for extra effort. They're no longer being made, so they've become collectible. I'd love to get my hands on a few of them.
They could be anywhere on the island. The mines might be a good place to start. If you find any while you're exploring Solstheim, bring them here and I'll pay you for them.

name: Kyne's Sacred Trials
objective: participate in Kyne's Sacred Trials by hunting the guardian beasts blessed by Kyne
first_tasks: defeat the guardian wolf, crab and skeever and return to Froki

characters.name: Kyne
characters.description: the ancient goddess of humankind and beasts, who teaches us to respect the beasts

groups.name: Divines
groups.description: a pantheon of gods who replaced the ancient gods

items.name: Kyne's Sacred Trials
items.description: an ancient tradition, and a test to prove yourself to Kyne

tools: Froki thinks that the Divines are impostor gods
Froki gives the player the symbol of the wolf, the crab and the skeever: this will compel the guardian to appear when the player reaches the guardian's lair
description:
The Divines are stolen idols! Impostor gods, sold by silver tongues. No thank you. Froki will not forget Kyne, or her Sacred Trials.
Kyne's Sacred Trials is an old tradition, a test to prove your worth in the eyes of Kyne. Show that you're a hunter and no simple butcher. Kyne teaches us to respect the beasts and blesses the hunter who will face their champions. True hunters are those who survive the Trials.
Do you think you're strong enough for Kyne's blessing? I would be glad to pass this tradition down. You must defeat guardian beasts, blessed by Kyne. I'll anoint you with the symbol of the wolf, the crab and the skeever. This will compel the guardian to appear when you reach his lair.
Return when you've defeated the guardian wolf, crab and skeever.

name: Ashes to Eternity
objective: deliver Berit's ashes to Runil, the priest of Arkay

first_task_locations.name: Falkreath
first_task_locations.description: a town known for its graveyard

characters.name: Berit
characters.description: Thadgeir's old, dead male war companion

tools: NONE
description:
Falkreath is known for its graveyard, traveler. We've buried more dead than you can imagine.
I just finished giving my old war companion, Berit, a proper burial by fire. Old hard head hated the idea of being lost cold in the ground.
Could you deliver the ashes to Runil, the priest of Arkay? He'll know the right blessings to make for Berit's soul.

name: A Drink to Win
objective: win the drinking contest against Sam Guevenne
tools: NONE
description:
You look like someone who can hold their liquor. How about a friendly contest to win a staff?
Ha! So you think that I don't have a chance against you. We'll see about that. This is a special brew, very strong stuff. Let's get started.

name: The Prey
objective: remind the Dawnguard that they are the prey
first_tasks: track down a Dawnguard member, and kill him discreetly

quest_giver.name: Garan Marethi
quest_giver.description: a fellow vampire, who speaks elegantly

tools: NONE
description:
I've learned the whereabouts of a troublesome Dawnguard member. You will track him down and dispose of him.
But please, do be discreet. Don't. Get. Caught. Our aim isn't to stir the nest, just to skin a rat, reminding them that they are the prey.

name: A New Debt
objective: help Drovas Relvi with his debt to Mogrul

reward.description: Mogrul will stop sending his debt collectors after the player

characters.name: Drovas Relvi
characters.description: a man the player recruited for Neloth, and thus became untouchable

tools: Drovas Relvi owes Mogrul 1,000 septims: Mogrul thinks that the player should pay Drovas Relvi's debt
description:
It seems you've inherited a problem. Drovas Relvi owes me 1,000 septims. At least he did until you set him up with that powerful wizard. Now he's untouchable. The way I figure it, it's your fault he can't pay me. So I guess I'm going to have to collect it from you.
And if you don't pay me? Nothing for now. But watch your back. I'll be sending collectors to find you. They won't ask so nicely. One way or the other, I'll get my money.
When you are tired of looking over your shoulder, you'll pay me.

name: A Precious Horse
objective: save Arvak from Soul Cairn

first_task_locations.name: Soul Cairn
first_task_locations.description: a terrible dimension where souls are trapped for an eternity

reward.description: the player will learn how to call Arvak to them

characters.name: Arvak
characters.description: a male horse, belongs to the soul

tools: NONE
description:
You must help me find my Arvak. He doesn't deserve to be in a place like this!
Arvak is my horse. We came to this horrible place together. We were attacked by monsters, so I told him to run.
Please, he's such a loyal creature, and he's been running for so long. You have to save him! A place like this will change you...
If you find him, I'll teach you how to call him to you. I'm sure he'd be much happier someplace sunnier.

name: Vald's Debt
objective: ask Vald to betray Mercer Frey
first_tasks: talk to Maven Black-Briar about erasing Vald's debts

quest_giver.name: Vex
quest_giver.description: a fellow thief, and Vald's ex-lover

characters.name: Vald
characters.description: a male thug who only understands gold

characters.name: Maven Black-Briar
characters.description: a powerful woman with criminal connections

tools: the player asked Vex information about Vald
description:
Vald? That pig? Oh, I have info on him. More than you care to know. Vald does not have a good side. The only thing he understands is gold. A man after my own heart.
You can try to buy him off, but he'll ask for a whole lot. I mean, you are asking him to betray Mercer Frey. Your best bet would be to erase his debt with Maven Black-Briar. If you talk to her, she might be able to give you the details.
Of course, you could just run him through and take what you need off of his corpse... I could care less.

name: Body Work
objective: restore Umahd's physical form
first_tasks: find the Ezrohir marauder who wears Umahd's wrappings

groups.name: Ezrohir
groups.description: a race of spirits, enemies of the Zeraphi

tools: NONE
description:
I am no ghost, only disembodied spirit: a Zeraphi warrior, torn from his wrappings, but unable to tear himself away from this world. Umahd is my name. I was defeated in battle, and my physical form taken from me, and made to serve the Ezrohir. But the Ezrohir Marauder who wears my wrappings has returned, no doubt thinking me long gone.
Find that Ezrohir Marauder! Restore my physical form, and I shall reward you!

name: Breaking the Siege
objective: free the Guardian of Mana
first_tasks: fight your way past the Ezrohir to the Guardian of Mana

first_task_locations.name: Riftkeep
first_task_locations.description: a nearby fortress that was designated as a neutral ground, where the Zeraphi and the Ezrohir could meet and talk over their differences, now occupied by the Ezrohir

groups.name: Ezrohir
groups.description: a hostile race of people, originally a faction of the Zeraphi

groups.name: Zeraphi
groups.description: a race of people, the player's allies

tools: NONE
description:
When the Zeraphi and Ezrohir "parted ways," they designated the nearby fortress of Riftkeep as a neutral ground, where they could meet and talk over their differences. But it has remained unused for centuries... until a few weeks ago, when the Ezrohir army seized the fortress. They have occupied it ever since, and that is surely where they are holding the Guardian of Mana while they marshal their forces.
The Ezrohir will be expecting the Zeraphi to attack them at Riftkeep, to attempt to rescue the Guardian. But they know it will take time for the Zeraphi to arrive. You can get there much more quickly, and fight your way inside before they are prepared to repel you.
Go. Fight past the Ezrohir and free the Guardian!

name: A Shattered Visage Lies
objective: help the Faceless King reunite the Zeraphi and Ezrohir
first_tasks: find the Royal Masks, and bring them to the Faceless King

quest_giver.name: Faceless King
quest_giver.description: the former king of the Zeraphi and Ezrohir, an immortal man

items.name: Royal Masks
items.description: the masks of the royal line, keys to the Vault of Souls

groups.name: Zeraphi, Ezrohir
groups.description: two warring races of people who were once one race

locations.name: Vault of Souls
locations.description: a place where the Faceless King can reunite the Zeraphi and Ezrohir

tools: NONE
description:
I am called the Faceless King, and I have resided here since the Zeraphi and Ezrohir were one race. I was their king. It has been my dream to reunite them by accessing the Vault of Souls, but the Vault will not open without the masks of the royal line, which were stolen from me ages ago.
If you can locate the Royal Masks and return them to me, I can unlock the Vault of Souls, and reunite the Zeraphi and Ezrohir! Please, my mortal friend... help me end this war.

name: The Blue Boletus
objective: bring Blue Boletus flesh to Sprocket

first_task_locations.name: Fungal Caves
first_task_locations.description: the only place where Blue Boletus grow

reward.description: Sprocket will be in the player's debt

items.name: Black Blindness
items.description: a disease peculiar to the Ponya, which dims the vision and makes speech impossible permanently after two weeks, can only be cured with Blue Boletus flesh

tools: Sprocket traveled here from his home village to find Blue Boletus for his cousins who are afflicted with the Black Blindness
description:
Oh, please - perhaps you can help us! On the advice of our village's healer, I have traveled here seeking a cure. My cousins are afflicted with the Black Blindness, an ailment peculiar to our race.
Black Blindness is an insidious disease - it dims the vision and makes speech impossible, and if not treated within a few weeks, can become permanent. The only known treatment is produced from the flesh of the Blue Boletus - a species of mushroom creatures that grows only in the Fungal Caves near here. I find that they are, ah, BIGGER than I had anticipated, however.
Perhaps YOU could retrieve some Blue Boletus flesh for us? We would be forever in your debt!
